subject: Parenting
title: Logical Consequences
description: A fast breakdown of Logical Consequences for builders.

hook.text: A child draws on the wall. Instead of yelling, you hand her a sponge. Connected, reasonable, respectful.

buildup.text: Logical consequences are parent-imposed outcomes that directly relate to the misbehavior.

twist.text: If the consequence doesn't logically connect to the behavior, it becomes punishment disguised as teaching.

punchline.text: The best consequence makes the child think, not just suffer.

quiz.question: What makes a logical consequence different from punishment?
